alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:13PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Tyler, southwestern Newton, northeastern Hardin, northwestern Orange and southeastern Jasper Counties through 1245 PM CST... At 1213 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fred to 6 miles southwest of Kountze. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Silsbee, Kountze, Call, Evadale, Fred, Buna, Pine Forest, Lakeview, Caney Head, Weiss Bluff, Gist, Trout Creek, Old Salem and Wrights Settlement. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hardin; Northern Jasper; Northern Newton; Orange; Southern Jasper; Southern Newton; Tyler
